title: OPEN URL IN MICROSOFT EDGE (CONTEXT MENU)
content:
I am attempting to build a script (extension) that will open any focused page in Firefox with Microsoft Edge from the context menu. The intention is to utilise the existing microsoft-edge URL Protocol in Windows instead of a native client.

The code below does in fact open Edge but only as a New Tab page and not the intended Firefox URL.

I seem to be missing something so any assistance would be appreciated.

function ff2edge(url) { 

   var link = url.replace(new RegExp("^.*//"),"microsoft-edge://")    browser.tabs.executeScript({        code: `window.location = "` + link + `";`    });

}

browser.contextMenus.create({ 

   id: "ff2edge",    title: "Open with Microsoft Edge"

});

browser.contextMenus.onClicked.addListener((info, tab) => { 

   switch (info.menuItemId) {        case "ff2edge":            url = info.linkUrl || info.frameUrl || info.pageUrl;            if (url) ff2edge(url);            break;    }

});

browser.browserAction.onClicked.addListener((tab) => { 

   ff2edge(tab.url);

});

title: Firefox using Apple Private Relay DNS
content:
Hello,

I'm trying to get my Firefox on Mac to use the DNS supplied by my DHCP. If I have Apple's Private Relay turned off, everything works correctly. However, if Apple's Private Relay is turned on, then Firefox will use Apple's Private Relay DNS (Cloudfare in my location). I have confirmed it's a configuration problem in Firefox because Chrome uses the correct DNS, and so does dig in the terminal.

I have tried:

  • Resetting Firefox to default settings
  • Uninstall and reinstall Firefox, including deleting the Firefox folder that contains the Profiles folder and profiles.ini file
  • Clearing cache and Firefox DNS at about:networking#dns
  • In Network Settings, tried 'No Proxy', 'Auto-detect proxy settings for this network', and 'Use system proxy settings'
  • Confirmed Enable DNS over HTTPS is not checked (If I check it, then it does work correctly, but that isn't my goal)

Thanks for any help!
